38670020.review:
And here we are back again, reviewing another game from Neko Climax studios we swore the first time was only a one time purchase, and that it slipped into our basket with a sale by mistake or that we really hated that friend that gifted this to us... Yeah right, lol. They keep making them and we keep buying them, don't we Mr Hentai-San :) ? There is something very nice about these games, uhm standing up ovation... HIde the feminist, prepare the inuendo jokes...let's review DSW Flat justice.

If you are a virgin to the deep space waifu series (see what I did there with the play on the word 'virgin' for an overly sexualised and nudity based game :) ) it is a shoot 'em up in space where you are a king bear (fluffy), riding a space bike (manly), shooting enemies (pew pew), but also shooting off clothes from a bunch of hot beauties below you ('bewbs'), who are distracting you with their talents (aaagh 'bewbs').

Flat justice gives us more new ladies than the original, with a catering to the uhm fans of flat chested breasted individuals, and also adds a story (if you are into anime you should be able to follow it, I didn't try to hard) about penetrating (hmmm) the police and dating every girl to find a mastermind behind some corrupt activity. But again, we do not play this game for the story do we? The game mechanics are top notch, and I think this is where a lot of fun is to be had since this is actually a great mechanical space shoot 'em up. 

The devs really listhened to our suggestions after the first game and they have added a new bike, new super weapons and specials. Hopefully we will get some babes of color with the next one, or a 3 bewb alien girl? Holding thumbs :) You still have the awesome neon menu colors, beautiful "bewbs" (optional nudy patch wink wink nudge nudge), great soundtrack and fun game play. I'm not a big fan of the whole 'cellphone' selection 'Tindery' type menu thing they have going, also when finished with a stage and after taking your photo, it would have been nice if the game just automatically goes to the next stage instead of going back to the selection screen. I think this would have improved the game flow as well. 

Pros - Beautiful babes, harder boss fights than original and enemies that are also more diverse strategy wise (MILF was quite a challenge and uhm I found it hard - that's what she said), good game mechanics, should run smoothly on most devices, wallpapers and photo's you may keep
Cons - Selection of a new stage manually after finishing one hampers game flow, not a fan of the 'Tindery' type menu, no babes of color or hot alien booty, not a game for everyone, once finished not alot of replayability, it will also offend with it's crude humor and nudity (again, if you are THAT guy, just ignore, move on and leave this one to us adults)

It's naughty, it's not PC and thats what makes it great. A worthy follow up to the original, still great, but needed minor tweeks. Thanks devs. 8/10

38569681.review:
This... this is actually a surprisingly solid casual shmup, playable and enjoyable by pretty much anybody, though complete with higher difficulty levels that, as a nice change, aren't requirements to unlock a single thing. You can play the whole game on "super casual" without ever being told that only hardcore players can progress farther, but those players possessed of harder cores can turn the challenge up.

Of course there's eye candy, censored by default but trivially uncensored, and the engaging "cloth destruction" mechanic that distracts you from the actual dangerous mobs. The girls are generally attractive enough, and cover a broad range of anime tropes. They're lightly voiced and lightly animated, and "completing" a girl adds her picture to the gallery for future... reference.

The sound effects are sparse but sufficient, and the music is actually surprisingly good. Get it out of your head if you can! As for the dialogue, well, it's 100% terrible, but entertainingly so.

Oddly enough, I'm recommending this one. It's not very long, but it's fun, and it's super cheap.

[h1]脱衣STGのパイオニアの続編[/h1]

あの人気脱衣シューティングゲームの続編がついに登場。
正式な続編ではなくスピンオフということらしいが、基本システムは変わっていない。
もちろん[spoiler]例のパッチ[/spoiler]も健在である。

続編にあたっての追加要素はストーリーが入ったのと、自機の種類が増えるといったモノ。
自機がパワーアップするということは、RPGでワンランク上の魔法を覚えるイベントが起きるようなもので、
「敵が強くなるフラグ」
である。

前回はぬるシューターでも気軽に遊べるゲームだったが、
今回はわりと難易度が上がっており、
ゴリ押しではキツいステージも出来て、
ラスボスはパターンを構築しないと倒せない難易度になっている。

しかし、あの「雑なイラストの女の子」がアプデやシリーズを重ねるごとにちょっとずつ可愛くなっていくのは嬉しい限り。
日本人からしたらまだまだだねってあたりだが、それはそれ。

アプデでトレカと実績が追加されて驚いた。

とりあえず男の子なら「買い」だ。
ただ、前作をやっていないならそちらの方から入った方がいい。

38409875.review: When I purchased the first Deep Space Waifu I had initially purchased the game as a gag, not ever thinking I'd find any value in a game I purchased for only a $1. Now after the increased sucess of the first game, Neko Climax Studios has managed to create a game that is simply amazing. So much heart and soul was put into the development of this game and it really shows in the games quality. The in game story is very funny. I love the way they added it into this one instead of it just throwing you in and going "strip some big ol' anime bozangas" like the previous game did. The gameplay is very fun, still continuing with the bullet hell shooter style as this game's predecessor except it changes things up a little by adding some new special attacks and two new bike styles. The art is really cute and drawn very well. The sheer talent that is put to work on these games and it blows my mind that they can sell this game and the previous title for only $1.99, and I purchased the game during the autumn sale so I got it for even cheaper. I highly recommend this game to anyone who loves bullet hells, qt anime girls, both, or are just looking for a cheaply priced game to pass the time. You won't be dissapointed.

38374214.review:
While an independent release, Flat Justice describes itself more as a "stand-alone expansion" and that's rather accurate. For the most part, it's basically the same as the original Deep Space Waifu and pretty much everything I wrote about it also applies to this release. There are a couple of differences, however (aside from a focus on flat chests and small breasts).

The original DSW was basically completely plot-less. Flat Justice, however, does have a story, complete with cutscenes. Of course, since it's still DSW, it's not serious at all and totally silly. Not to mention laden with some of the most unsubtle innuendos I've ever seen. But it sure adds something amusing to the game and I'd like to see more of that in future releases.

While the gameplay is mostly the same, just enhanced by a some new enemy types and weapons, a few levels shake things up a bit. For instance, one has you avoiding searchlights, failure to do so spawns new strong enemies. Another is a boss rush, that has to be done after 100% another level, and, when beaten, unlocks a new girl.

There are also two additional bikes to unlock, each with their own shot type. Particular the wide one is pretty handy.

The art, while not perfect, is significantly better than in the original DSW, with nearly all the waifus looking pretty good. Only one or two are rather meh.

Uncensoring the game is done in the same way as the first one, just put an empty "nude.patch" file in the "Deep Space Waifu Flat Justice_Data" folder.

Overall, it's mostly the same but more, but improved artwork several small additions make it arguably even better. If you liked Deep Space Waifu and want more, Flat Justice is certainly worth a purchase.

Also, it's probably the only game in existence where you can get called a "motherfucker" by JFK.

38335545.review:
The cosmos cried out for a hero, they cried out for help, they cried out for more nudes!

DSW: Flat Justice hasn't really changed too much from it's predecessor, they took the advice "If it ain't broke, don't fix it." to heart and gave us a stand-alone game but this time, le gasp!, theres an actual plot! Story to back up the smut! 

As our hero, Bear King, you must uncover an evil criminal conspiracy deep in the heart of the Metropolitan Police (insert current London City policing crisis joke here) through the tried and true method of modern policing in the year 2069 (Quois?). 

Yes, thats fighting the alien invaders while simultaneously blasting the bejesus out of the clothing of the giant women in the background, be they fellow cops or civillians. However unlike the last two episodes of DSW this time the attention is on those ladies less blessed with chest, a somewhat welcome change of pace from the typical butsy lasses in these sorts of games, and a definite angle on questionably skimpy police uniforms.

As stated before theres really not too much different from the previous game (Which I reviewed here: https://steamcommunity.com/id/Sephirothwolf/recommended/639790/ so go there for a more detailed discussion) though the new unlockable bike menu is a nice addition and the difficulty has raised sightly but not much. In short if you just fancy an SBG that caters to those with a taste for less-endowed ladies then you'll probably enjoy this more but other than that it's worth the £1.69 I paid for it. The story is basically useless fiimflam but it does add a bit more charm to the proceedings, just don't expect Shakespeare. All-in-all a welcome addition. Also, like it's predecessor, the sound track is worth a purchase too, especially if you own none of the DSW series and buy the bundle.

7/10, Recommended.

38334094.review:
[h1]На хайпе первого успеха[/h1]

Прежде чем обсудить продолжение, стоит обратиться к обзору оригинала:
http://steamcommunity.com/id/archer-dante/recommended/639790/
Зачем, спросите вы?
Потому что суть и формула игры всё те же, без изменений.

[h1]Что стало лучше?[/h1]
[list][*] Арты с девчушками стали лучше, как минимум уровня DLC предыдущей игры. В большинстве случаев добавлена мелкая анимация, дополнительный "отклик" на стрельбу и прочие фишки, которые по сути хоть и фансервис, но приятный.
[*] Появилось разнообразие леталок-стрелялок. 3 разных "байка" с более-менее разным подходом к стрельбе (на практике  оказывается пофиг)
[*] Новые Power-Up'ы , новые ключевые способности. В общем, ещё больше кастомизации вашей стрелялки
[*] Сложность стала выше, так же как и с DLC предыдущей игры. В любом случае это делает игру интереснее.[/list]
[h1]В чём большие провалы[/h1]
[list][*] Сделали игру хоть и качественнее, но контента стало меньше, это ощутимо
[*] Помимо контента сократился и список OST. Примерно в 2-3 раза по сравнению с оригинальной игрой. Это крайне плохо, учитывая что атмосферу в основном диктует в этой игре именно музыка
[*] Попытки запихнуть сюжет в игру меня хоть и удивили, но ни разу не порадовали. Такая дичь, что, пожалуй, какой-нибудь 13-летний подросток только подобное оценит, кого до сих пор на хихи от слов чл*н в учебниках пробивает. Лучше бы этого псевдо-сюжета не было, чем так.
[*] Релизнули игру, а некоторые персонажи появились лишь через время. То есть они вставили "болванки", а потом стали заменять их на что-то более-менее приятное глазу. Не ок подход.[/list]

[h1]Подведем итоги[/h1]
[list][*] Игра стала приятней глазу. Тот кто учится рисовать в команде разрабов делает успехи ощутимыми шажками раз за разом. Можно сказать, что если будут новые игры из серии, то можно будет ждать арты ещё лучшего качества. 
[*] У разрабов так же появились задатки звездной болезни. Да, стрип-игры с приятным геймплеем не такой уж частый случай, и у них получилось сделать что-то неплохо продающееся, но жертвовать музыкой или длительностью игры определенно не стоит.[/list]
[h1]Покупать?[/h1]
Элементарно~!
Покупайте, если понравилась предыдущая игра. Если не понравилась - значит и эта явно не для вас. А так как игры крайне идентичны и весь мой обзор - разбор деталей и нюансов, то вы ничего не потеряете, если начнете с более старой части.
Это ведь всё тот же Стрип Bullet-Hell, что и раньше.

[h1]Оценка: [b]3.5[/b][/h1]

[i]* Лично от меня оценка становится на 2,5 пункта ниже первопроходца из-за довольно грубых ошибок
Да, обращать внимание на такие нюансы извращение больше, чем содержимое игры, но всё же успех таких игр строится на многих вещах, а не просто стрип-механике.
Буду в дальнейшем следить за релизами от этих ребят. Что-то мне подсказывает, это только начало.[/i]

38329717.review:
Just like the original, it's a top down shooter game where you not only shoot enemies but strip the girls naked in the process. What is there not to love?

It has the same strange resolution issue as the original game, where unless I take my desktop resolution up to some insane number, the game doesn't go into full screen mode correctly. I have no idea if this is something wrong with the game or something wrong with my drivers/software. Either way, if you encounter this issue, just take your desktop resolution up to something higher and try relaunching the game.

I've run into some oddities (which may be fixed by the time you read this, so take this with a grain of salt), like menus overlapping or the game suddenly just becoming a background with some music, forcing me to ALT-F4 it but eh. Minor annoyances at best.

Certainly nothing that will really bother or stop me from recommending this game.

It is also very simple. like the original, keep this in mind. So it isn't especially balanced or fair at points. You have enough lives that a few unfair deaths won't really stop you. Bullets all drift toward or home toward you, which can box you in and leave you no way out sometimes and they're hard to see through all the firepower your guy is putting out, which may cause you to have a few WTF deaths here and there.

This game IS NOT to be taken seriously, it's casual fun and amusement and probably worth 3-4 hours or so, assuming you never came back after unlocking everything.

But the developer(s) of this are pretty committed their product.
The last DSW, they put out a buncha new content, and DLC for it in very short order.
(The DLC was like $0.99 so ..)

So that'll likely happen again here, giving you more to do for the whole $2 the dev(s) ask for it.

Do it, it's funny, perverted and a guilty pleasure.

Oh and the music is really relaxing and good if you dig the style.

So first off id like to say this is a spoof shooter in the sense it doesnt take its self seriously but as you start if your a completionist then you cant help but get addicted to trying to manage to unclothe the girls for the 100% part, killing enemys and collecting stars for the 5 star rating on each level.  
Dont get me wrong this is no bullet hell shooter its to casual for that but at the same time managing the points above can feel like your in a bullet hell game (not trying to start any arguments this is my personal oppinion).
The music is good and feels to fit the game nicely just like its predecessor Deep Space Waifu and feels to me very refreshing.
the art style again is very good in my personal oppinion and if your a fan of anime style waifu material you could do much worse than the offerings in this game.
back on the gameplay again the controls are responsive with various levels of sensitivity placed on a slider bar for total control and comes with a few modes including killing the enemy without damaging the clothing on the girls along with others that unlock once you have completed a lvl to 100% and 5 star rating (not going to go into ithere though lol youll find out if you play the game.
so far in the brief time i have spent on the game i have found that upon completing the first girl/lvl that the game frezes and does not recover have only tried the first two girls at this point and second girl/lvl turned out fine and gave me a little story to run on but this does not detract from the game as im sure this can be fixed fairly quickly by the dev.

my final words are tis ipicked up both waifu games with soundtracks when they were on offer (think I've paid less than a fiver for the lot) and for the price of the games I can't fault the amount of content, it will provide a few hours of fun when you just want a chill game.

if you like shoot'em ups in anyway and want something not to serious and fun then i do recommend this.

38245981.review:
The Year is 2069. 
The world is in peril, as corruption takes over the once great city. 
It's up to you - Detective/King Bear, on your bitchin' space chopper armed to the teeth - to expose the corruption that is deeply penetrating and violating the Lolipolice. 

BY DATING ALL THE WAIFUS

The sequel to the 2017 Classic - Deep Space Waifu. Flat Justice adds a great many things to what was already debatebly (Not debatebly though) the ultimate game concept. A strip-em-up bullet hell game where sweet synthwave music and sounds of female ecstacy pulsate in tandem with a neon laced wet dream of damn fun danmaku. 

Graphics are improved as well as framerate, which is important because the "bullet" part of this game has been increased by A LOT. You'll be facing new enemies and bullet types out the gate - really putting your skills to the test. What skills? Isn't this just a joke game out of the anime creepyland mothership? No sir. It's not. 

The excellent artwork and varied characters you'll be flying around and disrobing is incredibly well done and also distracting, which adds a whole layer of challenge you may not be used to while dodging bullets. This provides a fun experience that brings you coming back for more. Like in the original; the game returns to title after completion of a date - which means you can get a date or two in when you just feel like dodging a few bullets and seeing some excellent plot. 

Speaking of plot? This sequel has one. And it's hilarious. The dialogue is extremely cheesy and well written and avoids the common trap of games today utilizing memes in lieu of straight out humor. I found myself unable to make it through a complete sentence without cracking. The writer deserves props. 

The classic weapons from the first game are back, the powerful rocket launcher and the enemy seeking laser - but wait! There's more! Short range lasers that emit from your ship dealing constant close range damage, a rotating shield that provides protection against enemies, and of course the HEAVY MACHINE GUN. 

Unlockable bikes with varied base shot types are excellent, and provide variety that will allow you to choose the best bike for the job when you revisit those old dates and aim for that 100%. 

The soundtrack is fantastic and features more variety and more intricate tracks than the original (Which was good, don't get me wrong) But from the start of the game the whole game exhudes synthwave glory. 

With new bosses, new enemies, new weapons, and new girls (Let me emphasise girls. If you're into boobmonsters this game lacks that. But if you like your women how you like your Earth? Strip on baby, strip on.) Flat Justice is a perfect sequel, and a blast to play. 

With no reservations? I give Deep Space Waifu : Flat Justice, a resounding 10/10. It's fun, funny, and sexy. Like that girl you never talked to. 

Go pick it up today, after all - The force needs you.

Вообще неожиданно, что ещё глубоко-космо-вайф завезли. Как и прежде, можно играть одной рукой, спешлы те же, но вот тут что-то новое ещё прикрутили. Байков новых ввели, теперь можно по-разному стрелять. Галерею завезли ещё, хотя на кой леший она, если папка на винте есть. Может, для того, чтобы калибровать джойстик, не выходя из игры? Возможно. Контента пока мало, может ДЛЦ за тридцатку сюда завезут попозже, с первой игрой прокатило же так, ну? Появились какие-никакие сюжетные катсцены, что немного необычно. Конечно, есть одна проблема небольшая - некоторые девушки прямиком из первой игры, но перерисованные и перелопаченные на здешний лад (хорошо, что это пофиксится). Халтура, одним словом. Патч пилится также, хорошо, не поменяли, на том спасибо. Проходится, как и прежде, за час-два (на деле больше, ибо сложность нарастает из уровня к уровню), если выбрать, например, только одно-рук режим. Тем не менее, ещё ввели некоторую сложность: некоторые уровни на 5* с первого раза хрен пройдёшь, ибо 8 жизней улетят быстро, да и враги живучие местами. А так, в целом, игра неплохая, благо дешёвая (лично я её за 42 рубля взял с учётом скидона). 
7 из 10.
P.S. Честно говоря, я переписывал обзор несколько раз и только в этот - я изменил своё мнение об игре. В прошлый раз я влепил игре 4 из 10. Вывод: не обозревайте наспех и, к тому же, на нетрезвую голову. :)
P.P.S. Прочёл одну ревьюшку, на которую разраб ответил и хочу пожелать ему удачи с обновлением игры.

38216712.review:
[b][i]Deep Space Waifu[/i] was a great game with a silly premise: use a spaceship to strip pretty girls down so you can snap a picture of them.  But, believe it or not, I have had a few friends say that they dislike that game (and anime in general) because most of the girls in games and anime have an unrealistic breast size.  Until now.

[i]Deep Space Waifu: Flat Justice[/i] is not only the sequel we never knew we wanted, but it's fanservice is geared toward the fans of the more less endowed ladies with the largest chest in this game falling into the modestly sized C Cup range.

Do you remeber the great gameplay that you loved and enjoyed from the orginal [i]Deep Space Waifu[/i]?  Still there, along with a few different power ups to enable you to truly mix things up.  The art is as good as the first game, the controls are solid, the music is great, and the challenge is not only there, but turned up a notch because there's a wider variety of bosses to fight in this installment than the previous one.  And of course, the return of the one handed mode for those wanting to turn [i]DSW[/i] into a 'twin stick shooter'.

What's more, there is now a story behind this game, albeit a ridiculous one:  you are tasked with finding a legendary hidden waifu the public desperately wants.  However, there is a secret organization that is not only hiding her, but  thanks to rampant corruption within a police department the investigation has ground to a halt.  So in order to locate this waifu you need to uncover this corruption by dating every woman on the police force. There is lots of sexually oriented tounge-in-cheek humour to get at least a chuckle or two out of players before they go back to dodging everything but the kictchen sink.

So, if you loved the first [i]Deep Space Waifu[/i], go on ahead and grab this sequel.  I mean, it's base cost is only $2 so you have no reason to NOT get it.[/b]

38214785.review:
[i]В своё время я поставил вполне завышенную оценку "Хорошо" прошлой части [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/AntonPinigin/recommended/639790/]DEEP SPACE WAIFU[/url] и DLC к ней [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/AntonPinigin/recommended/701531/]DEEP SPACE WAIFU ACADEMY[/url] ознакомиться с обзорами на которые можно кликнув на их название.[/i]

[h1]ОЦЕНКА*[/h1][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=412623516]*Что означает каждая оценка? А также полный список всех моих обзоров можно увидеть кликнув по этому тексту.[/url]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=837949785
[h1]РАЗБОР ИГРЫ[/h1]
[b]DEEP SPACE WAIFU: FLAT JUSTICE[/b] такой халявы уже не получит. Чтобы узнать об этой игре ты можешь смело прочитать мой обзор на основную часть и вся картина сложится почти полностью.
К DLC я писал какие [b]Neko Climax Studios[/b] молодчаги, и что в дополнение вносят достаточно много новшеств, но сейчас абсолютно обратная ситуация.

[b]FLAT JUSTICE[/b] же это уже отедельная игра которая из ношеств даёт только какой-то намёк на сюжет с кучей пошлых каламбуров и шуток типа "Надо дать понюхать трусики девочке-собачке".

Геймпленой разницы почти никакой: появились бомбы зайдя в зону которых они детонируют и добавили пару разных кораблей-скутеров, что меняют рисунок стрельбы, но это ни на что толком не влияет.

Боссы скучные и слабее чем в [b]WAIFU ACADEMY[/b], большая часть девушек - перерисовка прошлых тянок, ошибки интерфейса так и не поправили: он всё так же абсолютно неуправляемый через геймпад. Последним гвоздём в крушку гроба оказывается, что для отдельной игры даже карточек не завезли. 

[h1]В [b]WAIFU ACADEMY[/b], как и в прошлые выпуски, приятно поиграть часик-другой (а больше игра и не займёт), но лично я почувстовал себя обманутым.  [/h1]

[b]P.S.[/b][i]Из переписки с разработчиком я понял, что он сильно болеет душой за своё детище. И он указал мне на пару моментов, которые я забыл упомянуть в своём обзоре. В том числе на громадного последнего босса в финале, который сделан хорошо. Мне нравится этот настрой и, возможно, я и правда вспыльнул. 
Я поменял оценку с отрицательной на положительную в Steam потому, что на самом деле хочу поддержать разработчика. Но свою оценку Плохо я решил не менять -  осадок у меня всё равно остался. [/i]

The challenge has been increased much further, with new enemies, harder bosses, environmental dangers (Mines) and more. To counter that, you get access to three different bikes as you progress, each one giving you a different shot type. (Narrow, Spread and Homing)

Unlike the previous game and its DLC where there was no story, this one actually has a plot. It's a silly plot, but you get an introduction to the game and a cutscene after beating each girl. The difficulty in this game is the highest so far, so I would recommend most of you start on Casual mode or easier, especially for the final boss's level. [spoiler]If you beat it with 5 stars and 100% clothing damage, you get immediately placed in a special bonus level. Have fun! >:D[/spoiler]

38185838.review:
Not as high in quality as before. 

So I won't lie, it's your standard ecchi game, and if you've played Deep Space Waifu, you'll be pretty much used to this already. It has some small new mechanic changes, and some major ramps in difficulty in some regards, which is nice, but that's when the game starts to deviate slightly.

The inclusion of loli content was... Well, a bit gross, but hey, your tastes may vary. 

However, that's where the subjectivity gets a bit different. The art style in this version has taken a significant dive as compared to previous versions, with images in the game being actually blurry as though they were made in the wrong resolution and expanded improperly. I mean, for a game that costs less than two bucks, it's not awful, I just expected a little bit better in the quality department is all. 

Long to short, scale the difficulty better, and fix the artwork, and then we're solid, but until then... meh.

38184418.review:
DSW: Flat Justice is a standalone expansion of [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/639790/DEEP_SPACE_WAIFU/]Deep Space Waifu[/url] which is a fine shmup in its own right.  Yes, it's still about blowing up clothes off of giant space waifu's, but it's nicely produced and it's fun.

They both share a unique chill quality: the Hotline-Miami-like neonscape, challenging yet not too challenging gameplay, soothing synthpop by [url=https://funnydeath.bandcamp.com/]Funny Death[/url], and of course the 2D waifu's drawn with a touch of folk art - they all make for a nostalgic throwback to the halcyon days when videogames offered simple playful entertainment, when people were not so easily offended.

DSW:FJ builds on that foundation, then wrap it up with a delightfully campy story mode inspired by a meme "flat is justice."  It's also slightly content-richer than the base game; with many imaginative multi-stage boss fights, unlockable vehicles and much-requested gallery mode, it's probably the most complete package Neko Climax Studios have put together to date.  The gameplay has become notably tougher, but there are custom difficulty levels all the way down to Super Casual, so that shouldn't be a concern.

Also, the devs are awesome guys, diligently tweaking, improving and expanding the base game since its launch through healthy community feedback loop.  I'm confident the same will go for this spinoff as well.

I heartily recommend DSW:FJ to anyone looking for a casual old-school shmup who is open to/appreciates playful softcore lewd, flat-fetish or not.  And the base game DSW as well, for that matter (there's a [url=http://store.steampowered.com/bundle/5644/DEEP_SPACE_WAIFU_COLLECTION/]franchise bundle[/url] for your pleasure.)

38140970.review:
A standalone expansion for Deep Space Waifu, Deep Space Waifu: Flat Justice is twelve additional stages, complete with several new bosses which continue the trend from Academy of being significantly harder and more interesting than the ones in the base game. In addition, it continues having surprisingly good audio design and mostly consistent visual design - though I felt some of the girls who make up the backgrounds were poorly-drawn this time around, most notably Pucky - as well as adding new features by having new versions of your main weapon unlocked as you go through the game, giving you spread shots and somewhat strange piercing shots to choose from in addition to your standard focused shot.

As I said about the original game, it comes through with its premise, even though the premise is incredibly silly, and my gripe about the stages feeling samey is significantly alleviated by the better boss design in this expansion. It's an incredibly short game, at under 2 hours, but given that it's a $2 fanservice game, this is probably to be expected.

As with the original, I'm going to give Flat Justice a thumbs-up, and recommend it over the original because it does everything even better. My few caveats - that it's not worth going out of your way for, that it feels incredibly sleazy, and doesn't really work as porn - still apply, but it's still a competently made, if very easy, shooter for $2, complete with naked anime girls. If that sounds like what you want, it's not going to let you down.

EDIT: They patched in a 13th girl as a postgame bonus. I'm pretty sure her boss is reused from one of the previous level sets, but it was a free bonus so I'm not really going to complain.

38137155.review:
Well, it's sort of a sequel to Deep Space Waifu.
A rather easy kind of bullet hell shooter.
The gameplay is exactly as in the trailer and that is basically what you get.

Lot's of girls, various bosses and it got quite a bit harder than the original.
More wonderful music for dream-like states from Funny Death.
Having listened to some of Funny Death's albums, I'd point out that the game really takes from the top of Funny Deaths best songs. Still worth a visit if you're into that 80ties synthie thing. So definitely consider the soundtrack.

Patch works the same way as in the predecessor.

Oh, what stays the same as in the predecessor is the really fluid well-balanced gameplay.
Controls are tight and feel great, specials give some variation.
There are three ships to unlock now, which offers some balance for difficulty as well.
The story is cheeky as hell - just like it should be.

Short word on the art. It pretty much seems to stay on the same level as Deep Space Waifu HD.
I enjoy it a lot, the expressions got better and are animated more smoothly.
The gallery mode within the game is a great addition too.
If there's anything I could wish for, it would be Mouse only mode with less lives and more points.

It is a great successor, building on great mechanics, adds some and develops the strengths.
A good lesson on how to expand on and develop a successful game.
Definitely a recommendation.
Haven't spent too much time yet, certainly looking forward to more time with it.
